author.name: Bryan Berry - Nathen Harvey - Matt Ray

entry.title: ChefConf Preview
entry.content:
Watch now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Download
    • Video
    • Audio

Panel

  • Brian Scott twitter, github, blog
  • Bridget Kromhout twitter, github
  • Christine Draper twitter, github, blog, website
  • Jamesha Fisher twitter
  • Jeff LaPlante
  • Jennifer Burke twitter
  • Jennifer Davis twitter, github
  • Jessica DeVita twitter
  • Jon Cowie twitter, github
  • Karolin Beck twitter
  • Matt Wrock twitter
  • Mukta Aphale github, twitter, TechLinguist
  • Harold "Waldo" Grunenwald twitter, github
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Chef Conf 2015: Game On! March 31 - April 2 at the Santa Clara Convention Center in Santa Clara, CA.

Day 1: Tuesday, March 31st

  • Workshop - Introduction to Chef: Managing Linux
    • Diversity Scholarship
    • Diversity in the Chef Community
  • Chef Community Summit
    • Open Space Event
  • Welcome Reception Beverages & Snacks provided.
    • 5:30pm - 7:00pm in the Exhibit Hall
  • Chef Meetup @ Ooyala
    • Ooyala

Day 2: Wednesday, April 1st

  • 5K Run
  • Power Yoga with Marilyn Olson Timberman
    • Yoga is located on the 2nd floor foyer, just at the top of the escalator from the Conference Center's Main Foyer.
  • Keynote Sessions
    • Nathen Harvey
    • Barry Crist and Justin Arbukle
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 1)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 2)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 3)
      • Standard Bank: Our DevOps Journey (part 4)
    • Surprise Speaker!!
  • Track Sessions
    • Brian Scott and Jeff LaPlante: Disney DevOps: Automating the Enterprise with Supermarket, Containers and BI
    • Bridget Kromhout: Cooking Up Drama
    • Jamesha Fisher: Securing the Heart of Automated Infrastructure
    • Matt Wrock: Entering the Chef Ecosystem from a Windows Background
  • Panel: Have Your Bets On Open Paid Off? with Cade Metz
  • Sponsors' Happy Hour
  • After Party at Levi's Stadium
  • Game Night

Day 3: Thursday, April 2nd

  • Gentle and Slow Yoga with Marilyn Olson Timberman
    • Yoga is located on the 2nd floor foyer, just at the top of the escalator from the Conference Center's Main Foyer.
  • Keynote Sessions
    • Adam Jacob
    • Jez Humble
    • Nicole Forsgren
  • Track Sessions
    • Jessica DeVita: Automate What You Can, Document What You Can't and Have the Wisdom to Know the Difference
    • Christine Draper: Serve Meals, Not Ingredients
    • Jon Cowie: [Workflow Design: Extracting Signal from the Noise
    • Harold "Waldo" Grunenwald: Chef Retrospective
    • Mukta Aphale: Baking Docker Using Chef

Other Talks and Information

  • POSHChef
  • PowerShell from the Group Up
  • Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) for Veteran Chefs
  • Networking SDD: Same Stuff, Different Department

  • Managing Databases with Chef

  • Twitter list of all ChefConf Speakers

  • Awesome Chef Awards

  • Friday Hack Day
    • Mountain View
  • Chef as a Welcoming Community
    • Reaching Out to Community Newbies (Upcoming Program!)
  • Thursday Lightning Talks: DevLOLOps - How To Automate Your DevOps Hilarity
  • Thank You Jennifer Burke!!

Download

  • Video
  • Audio

The Food Fight Show is brought to you by Bryan Berry and Nathen Harvey with help from other hosts and the awesome community of Chefs.

The show is sponsored, in part, by Chef Software, Inc..

Feedback, suggestions, and questions: info@foodfightshow.com or http://github.com/foodfight/showz.

entry.title: Chef Metal
entry.content:
Join us as we discuss chef-metal with it's creator, John Keiser

Watch Now

  • Panel
  • Outline
  • Picks
  • Download
    • Audio
    • Video

Panel

  • John Keiser github, twitter
  • Dafydd Crosby github, twitter, blog
  • Matt Wrock github, twitter, blog
  • Ranjib Dey github, twitter, blog
  • Matt Ray github, twitter, irc: mattray, blog
  • Brandon Burton github, twitter
  • Nathen Harvey github, twitter, irc: nathenharvey, blog

Outline

Chef News

  • Managing Windows Servers with Chef - A new book by John Ewart
  • DockerCon - June 9-10
  • Chef Fundamentals Webinar Series
  • Texas Linux Fest - June 13-14
    • Chef Workshop - June 13
  • Austin Chef Meetup - June 18
  • Velocity - June 24-26
    • Chef hack day at Velocity
  • DevOpsDays Silicon Valley - June 27-28
  • Upcoming Training
    • Boston - June 16-17
    • DC - June 18-19
    • Online - Windows class - June 23-25
    • San Francicso - June 25-26
    • London - June 26-27

Show Notes

  • chef-metal - A library for creating machines and infrastructures idempotently in Chef.
    • Drivers
      • Chef Metal: Automate Your Whole Cluster In Chef - #ChefConf 2014 Presentation on Chef Metal
  • spiceweasel - Generates Chef knife commands from a simple JSON or YAML file.
    • Clusters
    • Code Smell
  • Running Recipes (Provisioning)
  • Using chef-metal in action (Use cases)
    • chef-mental and test-kitchen
    • Orchestration
  • Getting Started with chef-metal
  • Autoscaling
  • chef-metal-fog - a Fog provisioner for chef-metal

Picks

John Keiser

  • The Berkshelf Internal API
  • Harry Potter and the Methods of Rationality by Less Wrong

Dafydd Crosby

  • chef-metal
  • OpenBSD
  • Test-Driven Infrastructure with Chef: Bring behaviour-driven development to infrastructure as code by Stephen Nelson-Smith

Matt Wrock

  • ThinkPad X1 Carbon Ultrabook
  • Ubuntu on Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon 2nd

Matt Ray

  • Pete Cheslock: 17th Century Shipbuilding and Your Failed Software Project
  • James Mickens: Say "Word Count" One More Time
  • SoftwareDefinedTalk Podcast, @SoftwareDefTalk
  • EmacsATX

Brandon Burton

  • Rebuilding a Bird in Flight
  • The Riftwar Cycle

Nathen Harvey

  • Pittsburgh!
  • From Hero to Zero
  • chef-metal
